intro: Lippia deserticola, commonly known as desert lippia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant leaves and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it well adapted to harsh desert environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small animals. Lippia deserticola is also used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities for its purported health benefits.
